oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: First International Festival of Country and Western Music - London, England - BBC
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: First International Festival of Country and Western Music coverage, featuring Stephen West (announcer) and David Allen (announcer) doing various interviews with performers and producers, located in London, England, broadcast on BBC.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: Opening statement ([Unidentified]) -- Stephen West talks about the First International Festival of Country and Western Music -- West talks about the schedule for the Festival and introduces David Allen -- Allen talks about doing an interview with promoter Irvin Kahn -- Allen interviews Loretta Lynn -- Lynn talks about her being surprised of the acceptance and popularity of country music in England -- Allen interviews Conway Twitty -- Twitty talks about the great success of the festival -- Allen interview Bill Anderson -- Anderson talks about the future success of this festival in London -- Allen interviews Jan Howard -- Howard talks about how kind the people of England are -- Allen interviews Hubert Long -- Long talks about how impressed he was with the festival -- Allen interviews Joe Walker -- Walker talks about what the CMA does for country music -- Allen talks about the various sub-genres presented at the festival -- [Unidentified] talks about the great success of the festival -- Allen interviews Charlie Walker -- Walker talks about how the origins of country music traces back to England -- Allen interviews Gordon Smith -- Smith talks about how great the festival was -- George Hamilton IV talks about the great success of the festival
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: BBC Radio;
